channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Hierarchical Knowledge
item.description: Graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) methods have significantly enhanced the performance of large language models (LLMs) in domain-specific tasks.

item.title: Explainable Bayesian deep learning through input-skip Latent Binary Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: Modeling natural phenomena with artificial neural networks (ANNs) often provides highly accurate predictions.

item.title: DGNet: A Neural Network Framework Induced by Discontinuous Galerkin Methods
item.description: We propose a general framework for the Discontinuous Galerkin-induced Neural Network (DGNet) inspired by the Interior Penalty Discontinuous Galerkin Method (IPDGM).

item.title: Whisper Speaker Identification: Leveraging Pre-Trained Multilingual Transformers for Robust Speaker Embeddings
item.description: Speaker identification in multilingual settings presents unique challenges, particularly when conventional models are predominantly trained on English data.

item.title: Learning Disease State from Noisy Ordinal Disease Progression Labels
item.description: Learning from noisy ordinal labels is a key challenge in medical imaging.

item.title: Characterizing Nonlinear Dynamics via Smooth Prototype Equivalences
item.description: Furthermore, our approach enables estimation of the invariant sets of the observed dynamics through the learned mapping from prototype space to data space.

item.title: AI-assisted Early Detection of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma on Contrast-enhanced CT
item.description: However, due to the lack of early and disease-specific symptoms, most patients with PDAC are diagnosed at an advanced disease stage.

item.title: ImageScope: Unifying Language-Guided Image Retrieval via Large Multimodal Model Collective Reasoning
item.description: To this end, we propose ImageScope, a training-free, three-stage framework that leverages collective reasoning to unify LGIR tasks.

item.title: The Curse of Conditions: Analyzing and Improving Optimal Transport for Conditional Flow-Based Generation
item.description: This is because the default optimal transport mapping disregards conditions, resulting in a conditionally skewed prior distribution during training.

item.title: Label Unbalance in High-frequency Trading
item.description: In financial trading, return prediction is one of the foundation for a successful trading system.

item.title: Flows on convex polytopes
item.description: We present a framework for modeling complex, high-dimensional distributions on convex polytopes by leveraging recent advances in discrete and continuous normalizing flows on Riemannian manifolds.

item.title: High-Resolution Uplink Sensing in Millimeter-Wave ISAC Systems
item.description: We then propose several methods for constructing a ``clean'' reference signal, which is subsequently used to cancel the effect caused by the clock asynchrony.

item.title: CoSTA$\ast$: Cost-Sensitive Toolpath Agent for Multi-turn Image Editing
item.description: Can we combine the strengths of both LLMs and graph search to find cost-efficient tool paths?

item.title: RFUAV: A Benchmark Dataset for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Detection and Identification
item.description: In addition to the dataset, RFUAV provides a baseline preprocessing method and model evaluation tools.

item.title: Adaptive political surveys and GPT-4: Tackling the cold start problem with simulated user interactions
item.description: Second, we compare the performance of an adaptive questionnaire that is randomly initialised with one pre-trained on synthetic data to assess their suitability for training.

item.title: Group-robust Machine Unlearning
item.description: MIU minimizes the mutual information between model features and group information, achieving unlearning while reducing performance degradation in the dominant group of the forget set.

item.title: AdvAD: Exploring Non-Parametric Diffusion for Imperceptible Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Imperceptible adversarial attacks aim to fool DNNs by adding imperceptible perturbation to the input data.

item.title: Unmask It! AI-Generated Product Review Detection in Dravidian Languages
item.description: The rise of Generative AI has led to a surge in AI-generated reviews, often posing a serious threat to the credibility of online platforms.

item.title: Neural Normalized Cut: A Differential and Generalizable Approach for Spectral Clustering
item.description: Spectral clustering, as a popular tool for data clustering, requires an eigen-decomposition step on a given affinity to obtain the spectral embedding.

item.title: Manify: A Python Library for Learning Non-Euclidean Representations
item.description: We present Manify, an open-source Python library for non-Euclidean representation learning.

item.title: How Well Does Your Tabular Generator Learn the Structure of Tabular Data?
item.description: In this paper, we carefully examine the limitations of the prevailing evaluation framework and introduce $\textbf{TabStruct}$, a novel evaluation benchmark that positions structural fidelity as a core evaluation dimension.

item.title: Efficient dynamic modal load reconstruction using physics-informed Gaussian processes based on frequency-sparse Fourier basis functions
item.description: Knowledge of the force time history of a structure is essential to assess its behaviour, ensure safety and maintain reliability.

item.title: Clustering by Nonparametric Smoothing
item.description: A novel formulation of the clustering problem is introduced in which the task is expressed as an estimation problem, where the object to be estimated is a function which maps a point to its distribution of cluster membership.

item.title: Towards Regulatory-Confirmed Adaptive Clinical Trials: Machine Learning Opportunities and Solutions
item.description: Randomized Controlled Trials (RCTs) are the gold standard for evaluating the effect of new medical treatments.

item.title: Block Diffusion: Interpolating Between Autoregressive and Diffusion Language Models
item.description: Diffusion language models offer unique benefits over autoregressive models due to their potential for parallelized generation and controllability, yet they lag in likelihood modeling and are limited to fixed-length generation.

item.title: Cost-Optimal Grouped-Query Attention for Long-Context LLMs
item.description: However, they overlook the impacts of context length and attention head configuration (the number of query and key-value heads in grouped-query attention) on training and inference.

item.title: ForAug: Recombining Foregrounds and Backgrounds to Improve Vision Transformer Training with Bias Mitigation
item.description: on ImageNet and 7. 3 p. p.

item.title: Training Data Provenance Verification: Did Your Model Use Synthetic Data from My Generative Model for Training?
item.description: Protecting these generative models is crucial for the well-being of their owners.

item.title: DRESS: Disentangled Representation-based Self-Supervised Meta-Learning for Diverse Tasks
item.description: Through this paper, we advocate for a re-examination of proper setups for task adaptation studies, and aim to reignite interest in the potential of meta-learning for solving few-shot learning tasks via disentangled representations.

item.title: Alias-Free Latent Diffusion Models:Improving Fractional Shift Equivariance of Diffusion Latent Space
item.description: Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs) are known to have an unstable generation process, where even small perturbations or shifts in the input noise can lead to significantly different outputs.

item.title: Towards Robust Multimodal Representation: A Unified Approach with Adaptive Experts and Alignment
item.description: Our results show that MoSARe outperforms existing models in situations when the data is complete.

item.title: Adaptive Temperature Based on Logits Correlation in Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Our method shows a promising result in different student and teacher models on a standard benchmark dataset.

item.title: Robust Asymmetric Heterogeneous Federated Learning with Corrupted Clients
item.description: This paper studies a challenging robust federated learning task with model heterogeneous and data corrupted clients, where the clients have different local model structures.

item.title: MindGYM: Enhancing Vision-Language Models via Synthetic Self-Challenging Questions
item.description: Large vision-language models (VLMs) face challenges in achieving robust, transferable reasoning abilities due to reliance on labor-intensive manual instruction datasets or computationally expensive self-supervised methods.

item.title: MP-HSIR: A Multi-Prompt Framework for Universal Hyperspectral Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, we propose MP-HSIR, a novel multi-prompt framework that effectively integrates spectral, textual, and visual prompts to achieve universal HSI restoration across diverse degradation types and intensities.

item.title: Implicit Contrastive Representation Learning with Guided Stop-gradient
item.description: But it is known that algorithms with negative sampling are not robust to a reduction in the number of negative samples.

item.title: PerCoV2: Improved Ultra-Low Bit-Rate Perceptual Image Compression with Implicit Hierarchical Masked Image Modeling
item.description: We introduce PerCoV2, a novel and open ultra-low bit-rate perceptual image compression system designed for bandwidth- and storage-constrained applications.

item.title: Fair Federated Medical Image Classification Against Quality Shift via Inter-Client Progressive State Matching
item.description: Existing fair federated learning methods have demonstrated some effectiveness in solving this problem by aligning a single 0th- or 1st-order state of convergence (e. g., training loss or sharpness).

item.title: VLog: Video-Language Models by Generative Retrieval of Narration Vocabulary
item.description: Human daily activities can be concisely narrated as sequences of routine events (e. g., turning off an alarm) in video streams, forming an event vocabulary.

item.title: SwapAnyone: Consistent and Realistic Video Synthesis for Swapping Any Person into Any Video
item.description: Video body-swapping aims to replace the body in an existing video with a new body from arbitrary sources, which has garnered more attention in recent years.

item.title: Token Weighting for Long-Range Language Modeling
item.description: We evaluate all methods on multiple long-context understanding tasks and show that non-uniform loss weights are helpful to improve the long-context abilities of LLMs.

item.title: Teaching LMMs for Image Quality Scoring and Interpreting
item.description: With this joint learning framework and corresponding training strategy, we develop Q-SiT, the first model capable of simultaneously performing image quality scoring and interpreting tasks, along with its lightweight variant, Q-SiT-mini.

item.title: LocAgent: Graph-Guided LLM Agents for Code Localization
item.description: By parsing codebases into directed heterogeneous graphs, LocAgent creates a lightweight representation that captures code structures (files, classes, functions) and their dependencies (imports, invocations, inheritance), enabling LLM agents to effectively search and locate relevant entities through powerful multi-hop reasoning.

item.title: Multiple Speaker Separation from Noisy Sources in Reverberant Rooms using Relative Transfer Matrix
item.description: Separation of simultaneously active multiple speakers is a difficult task in environments with strong reverberation and many background noise sources.

item.title: Search-R1: Training LLMs to Reason and Leverage Search Engines with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Efficiently acquiring external knowledge and up-to-date information is essential for effective reasoning and text generation in large language models (LLMs).

item.title: PISA Experiments: Exploring Physics Post-Training for Video Diffusion Models by Watching Stuff Drop
item.description: Large-scale pre-trained video generation models excel in content creation but are not reliable as physically accurate world simulators out of the box.

item.title: Towards Next-Generation Recommender Systems: A Benchmark for Personalized Recommendation Assistant with LLMs
item.description: To address this gap, we introduce RecBench+, a new dataset benchmark designed to access LLMs' ability to handle intricate user recommendation needs in the era of LLMs.

item.title: PairVDN - Pair-wise Decomposed Value Functions
item.description: Extending deep Q-learning to cooperative multi-agent settings is challenging due to the exponential growth of the joint action space, the non-stationary environment, and the credit assignment problem.

item.title: BUFFER-X: Towards Zero-Shot Point Cloud Registration in Diverse Scenes
item.description: Recent advances in deep learning-based point cloud registration have improved generalization, yet most methods still require retraining or manual parameter tuning for each new environment.

item.title: Regulatory DNA sequence Design with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The fitness of CREs, measured by their ability to modulate gene expression, highly depends on the nucleotide sequences, especially specific motifs known as transcription factor binding sites (TFBSs).
